co2-calculation: Assumption: similar to white flour, but with higher flour yield. Flour yield for white flour is on average 55% (2) and for whole grain flower 100%. Whole grain flower has a 45% higher yield.
author: JE
references:
1. Wikipedia specification of different flours in Switzerland: http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mehl 
2. Wikipedia information on flour yield different types of flours: http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ausmahlungsgrad
calculation-process-documentation:
Flour from wheat including still ca. 98% of the corn and with a mineral content of _> 1.7 % (1). It is a whole grain flour and includes the bran, germ and endosperm. White flour only includes the endosperm. 

Flour yield much higher than white flour. White flour yield between 50-60% (2).

Has a shorter shelf-life than white flour, because it includes the germ. Flour is produced from grinding the whole grains.
name: Vollkornmehl
comments: Not sure how the allocation in the milling process works between the different flour types and products?
